results.title: Round the twist Series 1 - Volume 1 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Antonia Barnard, Esben Storm, Steve Steve Jodrell and Mark Lewis
results.brief_description: The Twist family - 13-year-old twins Pete and Linda, their 8-year-old brother Bronson and their single Dad, Tony - move to an old lighthouse on the Australian coast. Here they encounter some unusual characters and strange happenings in a series of weird and comic adventures. Adapted for television from his own stories by the highly popular Australian children’s author Paul Jennings, each episode is a self-contained story with a surprise ending, guaranteed to send you “round the twist”. “Skelton on the Dunny” tells how the Twists deal with a haunted outside loo, while in “Birdsdo” rogue seagulls inadvertently help Linda and Pete prove that Nell is not insane. Pete meets a ghost who wants his help at the local tip in “A Good Tip for Ghosts”, and Bronson finds a baby in “The Cabbage Patch Fib”. In “Spaghetti Pig Out” the Twists find that, after being hit by lightning, their remote control works on people, with chaotic results. “The Gum Leaf War” takes Linda into the mountains where she encounters a strange and powerful tree. Wishes granted to the Twist family turn out not to be the boon that they seem in “Santa Claws”, while in “Wunderpants” Pete’s underwear has special powers. In “Lucky Lips” a magic lipstick makes Pete irresistible, and Dad wants to try his own luck.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Children’s Television Foundation, Patricia Edgar, Antonia Barnard, Esben Storm, Steve Steve Jodrell and Mark Lewis

results.title: Round the twist Series 1 - Volume 1 (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Antonia Barnard and Esben Storm
results.brief_description: A series of humorous and adventurous stories about the remarkable Twist family who leave the city to make their new home in a lighthouse. This volume includes “Skeleton on the dunny”, “Birdso”, “A good tip for ghosts”, “The cabbage patch fib”, and “Spaghetti pig-out”.

results.title: Round the island
results.creator_credit: British Transport Films, Ian Ferguson and Tony Thompson
results.brief_description: The Isle of Wight and its many attractions. The long established farms on the Downs; the ferry to the mainland; Uffa Fox, the famous yachtsman, comments on his love of the sea and is seen sailing in a race; inside a lighthouse; Tennyson’s home; Osborne House; a trip round trhe island to Carisbrooke Castle; the quiet villages, and ancient boatyards. Scenes of the Cowes Regatta, with some of the races and the gaiety in town and harbour.

results.title: Round midnight
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Irwin Winkler and Bertrand Tavernier
results.brief_description: A superbly crafted drama, a moving tribute to the great jazz musicians who lived and performed in Paris in the late 1950’s. Dedicated to the jazz giants, Bud Powell and Lester Young, the film features real-life jazz veteran, the gravel-voiced Dexter Gordon. It dramatises the friendship between an aging jazz saxophonist (Gordon) and a passionate young French admirer who is ready to make personal sacrifices to help his idol. Set to Herbie Hancock’s superb Academy Award-winning score, “Round Midnight” is an elegant, evocative ode to the free-spirited but technically demanding jazz music which blossomed in post-war Paris.

results.title: Round and around
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Produced for use in primary schools to stimulate interest in Melbourne’s annual Royal Agricultural Show. Shows without commentary all the hectic activity of displays, sideshows and the excitement of the Grand Parade.

results.title: Roughnecks: the Pluto campaign
results.creator_credit: Adelaide Productions, Audu Paden, Chris Berkeley, David Hartman, Sam Liu and Jay Oliva
results.brief_description: Using computer animation, “Roughnecks: The Pluto campaign” is five episodes from the American TV series. Based on the novel by Robert Heinlein, this series shares the same source material as the feature film “Starship troopers” (Verhoeven, 1997). On planet Pluto giant bugs are on the loose, threatening the lives of space station workers. A crack team of military crew (that naturally consists of a pair of new and green recruits) is dropped there on a mission to eliminate the bugs, no questions asked. Once there they discover that the task is much harder than envisioned and personal politics and feelings start to interfere with the mission as the danger from the marauding bugs increases. Bearing the aesthetic hallmarks of “Aliens” in its design, “Roughnecks” also mimics the space crew’s banter, tensions and infighting. The animation of the show is impressive but highlights the difficulties that arise for artists attempting to re-create human expressions. Funny and funky, “Roughnecks” is an entertaining series that doesn’t go anywhere new dramatically but has some witty one-liners and a great sense of the absurd. Cast includes Clancy Brown, Elizabeth Daily, David DeLuise, Bill Fagerbakke, Nicholas Guest.

results.title: Rouge [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Golden Harvest, Jackie Chan and Stanley Kwan
results.brief_description: Fleur, a courtesan in her former life, returns as a ghost to Hong Kong in the 1980s. She had failed to meet her lover, Chan, in the afterlife following their double suicide fifty years earlier. It seems that Chan, then heir to a fortune, did not die and is now a failed opera actor and film extra. The film is a portrait of Fleur - ‘one more addition to the long line of abused women in Chinese cinema’ (Tony Rayns), who, nevertheless is not a passive victim. Kwan elegantly constructs, through flashbacks, mildly satirical parallel visions of Hong Kong in the thirties and eighties creating a sense of the transience of things including love. Cast includes Anita Mui, Leslie Cheung, Alex Man. Based on the novel by Lee Bik-Wah. In Cantonese with English subtitles.
